titles.title: Ore no Imouto ga Konna ni Kawaii Wake ga Nai
My Little Sister Can`t Be This Cute
Няма как по-малката ми сестра да е такава сладурана
Не може моя сестра бути такою милою
我的妹妹才不会这么可爱
俺妹
おれいも
oreimo
oreimo1
俺の妹がこんなに可愛いわけがない
Oreimo
Ore no Imoto ga Konna ni Kawaii Wake ga Nai (saison 1)
Ну не может сестренка быть такой милой
내 여동생이 이렇게 귀여울 리가 없어
Mijn Zusje kan Onmogelijk zo Schattig zijn
我的妹妹哪有這麼可愛!
我的妹妹哪有这么可爱!

relatedanime.anime: Ore no Imouto ga Konna ni Kawaii Wake ga Nai.

recommendations.recommendation: For fans of comedy. You may or may not like this depending entirely on your views on the central character Kirino.
I probably didn`t get half of the jokes since my `otaku-score` isn`t that high, but i quite enjoyed it. Just give it a try :)
For all the Oni-Cans, Bishoujo Gamers, and Otaku`s everywhere ;). Very entertaining anime; easily enjoyable, and fun to watch :)

Just turn off all your senses and enjoy the show for what it is.
I did and I had a blast. Don`t go here looking for great story or characters. Just enjoy the countless implausible scenarios and remember that its just an anime.
An all-around good show. Nice art, enjoyable characters, good story development. Just a fun watch.

Entertaining (if thoroughly ridiculous) premise, characters that are enjoyable parodies of anime archetypes, attractive visual and audio design, all wrapped up in a show that starts and ends strong, but, admittedly, sags a bit towards the middle.
Ore no Imouto is pretty quirky yet enjoyable anime. Interesting characters, hilarious scenes and an overall fun watch.
This is a mirror for all us otaku who are so looked down upon from society :-)
One phrase to say, "One of the best anime ever!"
A dependable and strong main character, no excessive fanservice and lots of moe. I became incredibly attached to this one, and all its lovable characters.

It`s just that good. Of everything I`ve seen so far this is unrivaled the greatest series yet. It`s simple, yet the complexity in the train of thought in the characters makes up for that balance. Ecchi to say the least. I can really emphatize with the big brother and love how the difficult moments is described/animated.
It`s hard to say "for everyone" but "for most" this is a really good choice to watch.

anime.description: * Based on a light novel series of the same name by http://anidb.net/cr17862 [Fushimi Tsukasa], illustrated by http://anidb.net/cr17314 [Kanzaki Hiro]. http://anidb.net/ch17524 [Kousaka Kyousuke], a normal seventeen-year-old high school student, has not gotten along with his fourteen-year-old sister, http://anidb.net/ch17525 [Kirino], in years. For longer than he can remember, Kirino has ignored him entirely and even abused him. It seemed their relationship would continue this way forever. In what might have otherwise been just another day, however, he happens to find a DVD case for a http://anidb.net/t2503 [mahou shoujo] anime by the title of Hoshikuzu Witch Meruru (Stardust Witch Meruru) in his house`s entranceway. He mentally inspects every member of his household as potential owners, but discards everyone as impossible cases. Upon carelessly checking the case contents, he is startled to find inside the case not the corresponding DVD, but instead an adult game called Imouto to Koi Shiyo! (Make Love with Little Sister!). Determined to find out the owner of the goods, Kyousuke brings Meruru up at the family dinner table in a roundabout manner. His parents react very negatively towards the subject, especially http://anidb.net/ch22010 [his father], a policeman with a firm personality and a prejudice against anime fans. Kirino, on the other hand, abruptly ends her meal and disappears into her bedroom. Concluding the box could only be hers, Kyousuke decides to bring the truth out of her. In the dead of the night, Kirino violently wakes her brother up to talk to him, a completely unprecedented event. She drags him into her room and shows him a massive collection of cute girl-centered anime, manga and visual novels, a large share of which are adult games featuring young girls acting cute towards fictional older brothers, who are in fact the player. Kyousuke is taken aback, but now that Kirino has shared her secret with him, he is part of it, and there is no going back. He is about to be forcefully dragged into his sister`s life, in a way he certainly neither expected nor would have chosen had he been given the chance. — written by Hinoe

externalentity.identifier: 俺の妹がこんなに可愛いわけがない_(アニメ)

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: tsukkomi
tag.description: A tsukkomi is a comedy duo stock character in a traditional Japanese slapstick stand-up comedy style known as manzai. Tsukkomi characters are the smart, reasonable, and down-to-earth half of the unit; their simple-minded counterparts are the http://anidb.net/t1399 [boke] characters. As a result of their boke counterparts` simple mistakes and gross exaggerations, tsukkomi berate and abuse them both verbally and physically; a very common example of tsukkomi physical abuse is a paper fan slap, which is generally accompanied by a sound effect. Their approximate equivalent in Western culture is the comedy role of straight man.

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: cosplaying
tag.description: This character likes to cosplay.

tag.name: zettai ryouiki
tag.description: "Absolute Territory" (絶対領域, Zettai Ryouiki in Japanese) describes the area of uncovered thigh between the skirt and the knee sock. As per usual for fandom who obsess about costumes, this can be considered a moe attribute and thus, present prominently in character designs and schoolgirl outfits. The term originates from http://anidb.net/a22 [Neon Genesis Evangelion] to designate an area of Absolute Terror, although it`s had considerable semantic drift. In this case, it may jokingly refer to the fact it emphasizes a shorter skirt without actually becoming creepy and showing the underpants. As if that wasn`t enough, some even categorize it into five "Grades", from E to A. Only the top two (A and B) are considered true Zettai Ryouiki and they are only usable by female characters. Some researchers additionally introduce Grade S, the highest one which consists of Grade A plus further requirements to personality and hairstyle. Just to make it clear, Zettai Ryouiki is made up of three components: socks, skin, and skirt. An Action Girl may trade the latter for hotpants but if it doesn`t include knee-highs and thighs, it`s not Zettai Ryouiki. Panty Shot is an entirely different zone. For more information on sock lengths in general, see also: http://anidb.net/t6419 [hosiery] Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Tokyo
tag.description: Tokyo, officially Tokyo Metropolis, is the capital city of Japan and one of its 47 prefectures. The Greater Tokyo Area is the most populous metropolitan area in the world. It is the seat of the Emperor of Japan and the Japanese government. Tokyo is in the Kantou region on the southeastern side of the main island Honshu and includes the Izu Islands and Ogasawara Islands. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: pantsu
tag.description: "Panties" in Japanese. Upskirt views in various positions are typical, however all forms of partial or fully exposed panties are accepted. Exposure is usually accidental, but may also be deliberate. Pantsu views may be exclusive to the viewer without impacting any characters. Bikinis are not pantsu.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: ecchi
tag.description: Fan service is found in many anime, in many forms. When the service has a distinctly sexual slant to it, and it appears to be a major focus of the show, then it`s safe to assume you`re watching ecchi. The word "ecchi" is used by English-speaking anime fans to refer to refer to soft-core pornographic or sexually suggestive anime and manga. This is a western invention; in Japanese, it is a catch-all term for all things anyhow sexual in nature, not being limited to porn, but also not really considered a "milder" term, as it may also refer to sexual intercourse itself. The term "ecchi" in Japanese comes from the pronunciation of the letter "H" in English, which is rendered into Japanese syllabary as エッチ, which in turn is transliterated in the English alphabet as "ecchi" or "etchi". It is not, as many believe, short for "hentai" -- that, too, seems to be a western invention. It is, however, nearly as misunderstood and misapplied a term as "hentai". The line between ecchi and hentai, from the western perspective over these terms, can be hard to draw at times; one good rule of thumb is: if it was aired on Japanese public TV at all, it probably wasn`t hentai. Ecchi usually features all the specifics to human anatomy that can only be found in anime, and generally avoids full nudity, instead abusing of panty shots. Hentai, on the other hand, will usually show full frontal nudity in some explicit form, including genitalia, and full, intimate sex scenes. At its mildest, ecchi is composed of double entendres, big misunderstandings, and sexual farce; at its most explicit, it is still in the realm of softcore pornography, with full breast shots, full back nudity and similar content, but no display of genitalia. Another good way to distinguish the two is looking for animated sex scenes; if one is found, you have generally left the genre entirely, though a few borderline exceptions apply here. For AniDB`s purposes, the distinction between explicit ecchi and actual hentai is simple: if it was sold with a 18+ restriction in its country of origin, it is hentai; if it was sold without it, it is ecchi. Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: harem
tag.description: Harem is an entertainment-related trope which is characterized by three or more characters, normally female, who for some reason are in the presence and under the influence of one character, generally male, according to a few genre-defining guidelines; here it will be assumed, for simplicity of language, that the harem lead is a male character and the members are female characters. Though that is the rule, there are exceptions; a story in which there is one female character and several male characters is normally called a "http://anidb.net/t2792 [reverse harem]", or sometimes also "male harem". Aside from the swapping of the characters` genders, the trope`s details are mostly the same, with the majority of the changes relating to the differences in behavior between men and women of the characters` age range. It is also possible to create harems with homosexual relationships, again with very few changes to the main antics themselves. The harem may not have more than only one lead, as that would be a love polygon, or less than three members, as one would form a couple and two would make a love triangle. As a defining rule of harem, the interactions between the lead and each of the individual members are filled with romantically or sexually loaded content, either implicitly, through innuendo or subtext, or explicitly, through text or actions, and those actions are a key plot element. Generally, the female characters` looks and personalities will vary a lot among the ones present in one single series, but quite rarely will they actually differ from the common stock archetypes, which are known, well-defined, and easy to copy; for this reason, the genre as a whole is often considered repetitive. Usually, the characters involved directly in this trope are in the late teenager to young adult age range, but that is not mandatory. Sexually charged behavior on the lead`s part pretty much can`t be avoided, and it`s typical to see him stamped as a pervert by some or all of the members, regardless of whether he is one; the sexual tones also applies to the depiction of the harem members, often leading the genre to labeled sexist. The lead will often suffer very violent retribution for his behavior, which has attracted criticism of gratuitous violence as well. Most of the harem members will be romantically or sometimes sexually interested in the one male character, and in him alone; that, however, is not an absolute rule, and indeed sometimes none of the female characters are really interested at first, so the protagonist has to build relationships with them from scratch. That idea comes in large part from visual novels; it is quite common for visual novels to revolve around controlling the male lead and have him build relationships with either as many female characters as possible or with one of them, the latter being more common for visual novels with branched story paths; a large portion of those visual novels also feature erotic content, which may be hard to adapt to TV series. It may be also possible that the harem is only a support to the existing or predictable relationship between the lead and the most important member; additionally, the lead may end up in relationships with most or all of the harem members, with the agreement of all, in a setting normally called "harem ending".

tag.name: Akihabara
tag.description: Akihabara is a common name for the area around Akihabara Station in the Chiyoda ward of Tokyo, Japan. It gained the nickname Akihabara Electric Town shortly after World War II for being a major shopping center for household electronic goods and the post-war black market. Nowadays, Akihabara is considered by many to be an otaku cultural center and a shopping district for video games, anime, manga, and computer goods. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: real-world location
tag.description: Places seen in the show exist in reality. Note: This could be sometime in the future, though names and certain places will still be recognizable.

tag.name: ED variety
tag.description: Several ED sequences in this anime have either a different song or different animation, maybe even to the point of having a unique ED for each episode.

tag.name: indifferent
tag.description: Indifference or apathy is a lack of or a suppression of interest, concern, excitement, motivation, and/or passion. This may range from not caring enough to seek to get involved on matters that don`t directly concern the indifferent individuals to not caring about life itself, be it other individuals` lives or even their own.

tag.name: eternal blush
tag.description: It is no ordinary blush it is a blush that does not disappear.

tag.name: subtle OP ED sequence change
tag.description: A (small) part of the opening or ending sequence changes after a certain episode, usually to reflect a plot milestone.

tag.name: predominantly female cast
tag.description: A show with a predominantly female cast has mostly females as main and secondary cast members while few if any male characters have major roles. This also applies when a male lead is surrounded by females of lesser individual plot relevance, such as in a harem setting.

tag.name: video game development
tag.description: Part of the anime`s story relates to creating video games.

tag.name: intact family
tag.description: The main character`s family is a so-called "nuclear family". Wherein both parents are alive and present in his or her life. This is actually relatively rare for anime, where "parental abandonment" is the norm.

tag.name: show within a show
tag.description: A fictional TV (or radio, or stage) show that takes place within an actual TV show; or, occasionally, a fictional instalment or incarnation of an actual show. Many comedies have short one-off gags where they parody existing shows. Example: A large part of Martian Successor Nadesico is centred around the fictional popular anime Gekigangar III, which is being watched by several characters of the Nadesico crew.

tag.name: visible aura
tag.description: Characters are surrounded by a visible energy field usually representing inner strength, but not restricted to only that.

tag.name: call my name
tag.description: "TETSUOOOOOO!!" "KANEDAAAAAA!!" "TAMAHOMEEEE!!" "MIAKAAAA!!" Feelings of any kind towards other characters are best shown by calling each other`s name, loud, REALLY LOUD. For better effect at least twice or thrice. For lover`s couples and mortal enemies it is a requirement to run towards each other while calling each other`s name, unaware of the surroundings.

tag.name: otaku culture
tag.description: Otaku (おたく/オタク) is a Japanese term used to refer to people with obsessive interests, particularly anime, manga, and video games. A female otaku is occasionally referred to as a fujoshi. (Source: Wikipedia) Here certain aspects of this "fandom" are presented in more detail, e.g. the creation of doujinshi (self-published amateur manga).

tag.name: catchphrase
tag.description: A catchphrase is a sound, word or phrase commonly used by a person. That may be simply out of habit, or in an attempt to deliver some form of image, like that of cuteness. In fiction, characters often use catchphrases as a way to deliver specific personality traits. Examples include Otohime Mutsumi`s "ara ara" in Love Hina, Yang Wenli`s "yare yare" in Legend of the Galactic Heroes, Misuzu`s "gao" in AIR, Sakura`s "hoe" in Card Captor Sakura, Suiseiseki`s "desu" in Rozen Maiden, and Ayu`s "uguu" in Kanon (as well as several other characters in the same show).

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Aragaki Ayase
character.description: Aragaki Ayase is Kirino`s best friend, and like her also works part-time as a fashion model. She is initially very prejudiced against otaku culture, being biased by the treatment of otakus in the media. When she discovers that Kirino has such proclivities she breaks off their friendship, but Kyousuke manages to reconcile them, and he manages to get Ayase to grudgingly accept that part of Kirino.

character.name: Kurusu Kanako
character.description: Kurusu Kanako is a friend to Kirino and Ayase, and like them also works as a model, but is also a budding idol and can sing and dance very well. Like Ayase she is also biased against otaku culture, but Ayase manages to trick her into cosplaying as the main character in Kirino`s favorite anime Stardust Witch Meruru for a contest, whose prize is a limited edition Stardust Witch Meruru figurine. She manages to win the contest because of her uncanny resemblance to the main character, and her ability to sing the anime`s main theme so well despite never having sung it before.

character.name: Saori Vageena
character.description: Saori Vageena is one of the active female members of the anime forum that Kirino wound up frequenting, and organized the get-together in Akihabara where she met Kirino and Kuroneko for the first time. She is the peacemaker of the group, and her friendly disposition helps to defuse tensions between Kirino and Kuroneko, keeping their arguments about each other`s tastes from getting out of hand. She tends to speak in a very quirky way, always using a very polite and antiquated mode of Japanese generally heard today only in samurai movies. Not much is known about her for certain, not even her real name (Saori Vageena is her handle on the anime board and evidently a pseudonym), but brief scenes of her at home show her in what looks a large mansion, attended by maids and butlers, implying that she is very wealthy, although neither the Kousaka siblings nor Kuroneko seem to be aware of this.

character.name: Tamura Manami
character.description: Tamura Manami is Kyousuke`s classmate and childhood friend. She lives with her younger brother and grandparents, who are proprietors of a sweets shop a short distance from the Kousaka house. She has been friends with Kyousuke since childhood, and has a rather obvious crush on him that he seems oblivious to. She is rather frumpy and plain-looking and a little clumsy, but is also very kind and good-natured.

character.name: Kousaka Kyousuke
character.description: Kousaka Kyousuke is the main protagonist of the series, and acts as the narrator. He is a fairly ordinary second-year high school student who wishes for nothing more than a peaceful life until he accidentally discovers his little sister Kirino`s otaku hobbies. Even though Kirino is mean and disrespectful to him, he tries to be a good elder brother to her, giving her advice as best he can, and helping her to continue in her hobbies and make new friends. He is a responsible and reliable person who cares deeply about the welfare of his sister and of his friends.

character.name: Kousaka Kirino
character.description: Kousaka Kirino is the main heroine of the series. She is a 14-year old girl who seems normal on the outside, but is in secret a hardcore otaku obsessed with anime and visual novel eroges, especially those involving little sisters. She works part-time as a model, which is how she managed to purchase her most impressive collection of figurines, visual novels, and anime DVDs. She has a talent for writing, and loves track and field. She is initially cold and disrespectful towards her brother Kyousuke, but after he discovers her secret hobby and he supports her in it, they gradually grow closer.

character.name: Gokou Ruri
character.description: Kuroneko (a.k.a. Gokou Ruri) was one of the anime otaku girls Kirino had met in a gathering organized by Saori. Though their tastes in anime and games greatly differ, they nevertheless began to be good friends. She also became a good friend to Kyousuke, and it is hinted that she may have feelings for him. As befits the Kuroneko epithet, she is usually seen wearing a black Gothic Lolita-style dress, and is sharp-tongued and antisocial. She enters Kyousuke`s high school later in the series, and joins the Game Club at his urging, displaying her considerable talents at writing and graphic design.

character.name: Kousaka Daisuke
character.description: Kousaka Daisuke is the father of Kyousuke and Kirino. He is a police officer and takes a very dim view of otakus and otaku culture.

character.name: Meruru
character.description: Meruru is the main character in Kirino`s favorite anime Stardust Witch Meruru. This metafictional anime seems to be a pastiche of the various clichés prevalent in the magical girl genre. She is voiced by Tamura Yukari, who, not coincidentally, also voices Kirino`s friend Kurusu Kanako.

character.name: Comet-kun
character.description: Meruru`s animal sidekick in the metafictional anime Stardust Witch Meruru. Its appearance seems to be based roughly on Mokona/Soel from CLAMP`s Magic Knight Rayearth, Tsubasa Chronicle, and xxxHOLIC.

character.name: Gokou Tamaki
character.description: Gokou Tamaki is Kuroneko`s younger sister. She is in 1st grade.

character.name: Kyuubee
character.description: Kyuubee is a familiar who can grant any wish to a certain girl, on the condition that she become a Puella Magi and fight against witches. When someone makes a contract with him, he extracts their soul and places it inside a Soul Gem, replacing their body with a shell that`s more resilient to fighting witches. He has so far made contracts with Mami, Kyouko and Sayaka, and shows particular interest in making Madoka a magical girl. It is yet to be revealed if there are other familiars besides him. As a magical creature, he can only be seen or heard by Puella Magis and those with magical potential. He is shown to consume used Grief Seeds, though for what reason is unknown. His true motives are unknown, and he constantly tries to find chances to persuade girls with magical potential to form a contract with him despite knowing the dangers that a Puella Magi faces. He tends to have little understanding of human values and doesn`t believe what he`s doing is cruel. If he is killed, another Kyuubee takes his place and consumes the previous one. Homura recognizes his true identity as Incubator.

character.name: Akagi Sena
character.description: Kouhei`s little sister and a member of the Games Research club, as well as Ruri`s classmate. Similar to Kirino, she has an obsession with eroges, albeit she prefers the yaoi genre to an extent that she`ll even fantasise about her other clubmates, pairing her brother and Kyousuke as a couple. The relationship she has with her brother is quite strong yet unclear how they feel each other. She joined the Games Research club in order to learn how to become a games designer. She is also very good at games, having the high score before Kuroneko beat it. This also attributes to her skill in programming being able to debug very easily.

character.name: Miura Gennosuke
character.description: The president of the Games Research club at Kyousuke`s school, which both Kyosuke and Ruri end up joining. He is also into little sister-themed eroge, as Kyosuke first meets him when trying to borrow a bike to ride home following a midnight eroge launch.

character.name: Shikkoku
character.description: The "dark hero" of Kuroneko`s favourite anime, Maschera: Lament of a Fallen Beast.

episode.title: 俺の妹が夏コミとか行くわけがない
There`s No Way My Little Sister Would Go To Summer Comiket
Je n`irai pas au Comiket d`été avec ma petite sœur
Ore no Imouto ga Natsu-Comi Toka Iku Wake ga Nai
episode.summary: While Kirino has her school friends over, she receives a package from Saori, unaware it is a collection of otaku goods, forcing Kyousuke to stop her from opening it in front of her regular friends, but his attempts to protect it from her land them in an even more awkward situation. As way of apology for the incident, Kirino forces Kyousuke to take her to Summer Comiket, along with Saori and Kuroneko.

episode.title: 俺の妹がこんなに可愛いわけがない
There`s No Way My Little Sister Can Be This Cute
Ma petite sœur ne peut pas être aussi mignonne
No es posible que mi hermana sea tan linda
Ore no Imouto ga Konna ni Kawaii Wake ga Nai
episode.summary: Kirino`s father learns of her hobby and becomes angry at her. Kirino becomes upset that her hobby has been called "worthless" and runs off, prompting Kyousuke to catch up with her. After seeing Kirino show no desire to give up a part of her life, Kyousuke decides to actively support Kirino.

episode.title: 俺が妹とオフ会に行くわけがない
There`s No Way I`d Go to an IRL Meetup with My Sister
Je n`irai pas avec ma petite soeur dans ces réunions IRL
No es posible que vaya a un meeting con mi hermana
Ore ga Imouto to Off-Kai ni Iku Wake ga Nai
episode.summary: Noticing Kirino has no one to share her hobbies with, Kyousuke asks for advice from his friend, Manami Tamura, who suggests that she make some otaku friends. Kirino joins an on-line community and is invited to an otaku tea party at a maid café in Akihabara.

episode.title: 俺が妹と恋をするわけがない
There`s No Way I Could Love My Sister
Impossible de tomber amoureux de ma petite sœur
No es posible que me enamore de mi hermana
Ore ga Imouto to Koi o Suru Wake ga Nai
episode.summary: After bumping into his little sister, Kirino, in the hall, Kyousuke finds a magical girl anime DVD containing a little-sister themed adult game inside. Kyousuke soon learns the game belongs to Kirino and confronts her about it, though says she would not be weird for having such a hobby. Later that night, Kirino brings Kyousuke into her room where she reveals her secret stash of erotic games, and asks him for "life counseling".

episode.title: 俺の妹の親友がこんなに××なわけがない
There`s No Way My Little Sister`s Friend Can Be This XX
La meilleure amie de ma petite sœur n`est pas aussi coincée que ça ?
Ore no Imouto no Shin`yuu ga Konna ni XX na Wake ga Nai
episode.summary: Ayase puts pressure on Kirino and eventually discovers her hobby, telling her they can`t be friends any longer. Noticing Kirino falling into despair, Kyousuke tries talking to Ayase who cannot accept her friend`s hobby having seen reports of crimes relating to adult game. When all else fails, Kyousuke decides to take drastic measures.

episode.title: 俺の幼馴染がこんなに可愛いわけがない
There`s No Way My Childhood Friend Can Be This Cute
Mon amie d`enfance ne peut pas être aussi mignonne
Ore no Osananajimi ga Konna ni Kawaii Wake ga Nai
episode.summary: Manami invites Kyousuke over to her house to try out some sweets made by her family`s shop for a Halloween event. Her family consider these childhood friends kind of a married couple already, and Manami`s grandpa tricks them into sharing the same room that night.

episode.title: 俺の妹がこんなに小説家なわけがない
There`s No Way My Little Sister Can Write a Novel
Ma petite sœur ne peut pas être une aussi bonne écrivaine
Ore no Imouto ga Konna ni Shousetsuka na Wake ga Nai
episode.summary: Having read Kuroneko`s fan fiction online, Kirino decides to write some of her own. But in order to get material, and get into the right mood for writing, she drags Kyousuke around the city on Christmas Eve... but this isn`t a date, right?

episode.title: 俺の妹がこんなにアニメ化なわけがない
There`s No Way My Little Sister Could Get an Anime
Le roman de ma petite sœœur ne peut pas devenir un anime
Ore no Imouto ga Konna ni Anime-ka na Wake ga Nai
episode.summary: Kirino`s novel is flying off the shelves, and even getting an anime! But when Kirino dreams of getting her favorite stars for staff, and every last detail being perfect, the anime producers` goal is more mundane: Making money.

episode.title: 俺の妹がこんなにエロゲー三昧なわけがない
There`s No Way My Little Sister Can Play Eroge Like This
Ma petite sœur ne peut pas être fan de ce genre d`eroge
Ore no Imouto ga Konna ni Eroge Sanmai na Wake ga Nai
episode.summary: A day in the life of all characters: Kirino playing the latest eroge (loudly!), Kyousuke suffering from this, Kuroneko actually having family life, and Saori... well, she has quite a secret of her own.

episode.title: 俺の妹がこんなにコスプレなわけがない
There`s No Way My Little Sister Can Cosplay Like This
Ma petite sœur ne peut pas porter ce genre de cosplay
Ore no Imouto ga Konna ni Cosplay na Wake ga Nai
episode.summary: Ayase wants to give Kirino a present that the otaku would be happy about, and asks Kyousuke for help. After brainstorming with Saori and Kuroneko the three get a great idea for a present that Kirino would love; unfortunately it`s not for sale but the prize for a cosplay event of Kirino`s favorite anime! Ayase gets furious over the suggestion of her participating in this competition... but then she has an idea.

episode.title: 俺の妹がこんなにメイドなわけがない
There`s No Way My Little Sister Can Be a Maid
Ma petite sœur ne peut pas être une servante
Ore no Imouto ga Konna ni Maid na Wake ga Nai
episode.summary: When shopping for lunch, Kyousuke meets Manami and invites her to cook for him when his parents are away. Kirino doesn`t like it and makes the event a living hell for both. Some time later, Kyousuke gets an invitation from Saori to a special event; arriving there he`s welcomed by his "personal harem", consisting of Saori, Kuroneko, and Kirino... in maid costumes.

episode.title: 俺の妹の人生相談がこれで終わるわけがない GOOD END♡
There`s No Way My Little Sister`s Life Advice Can End Like This (Good End)
Les conseils pour ma petite soeur ne peuvent se finir ainsi
Ore no Imouto no Jinsei Soudan ga Kore de Owaru Wake ga Nai: Good End
episode.summary: Kirino suddenly is really nice to Kyousuke, and then asks him to do a last "life counseling" for him, by buying an eroge for her when it`s on sale - at midnight in Akihabara. But the real problems for Kyousuke begin when Kirino asks him to play the game together.

episode.title: 俺の妹がこれで最終回なわけがない
There`s No Way This Is My Little Sister`s Last Episode
Ma petite sœur ne peut pas avoir un final comme ça !
Ore no Imouto ga Kore de Saishuukai na Wake ga Nai
episode.summary: As Ruri and Sena`s game is bashed on the Internet they decide to work harder towards making a better game. As Kyousuke prepares to go home he receives a text message from Kirino telling him to throw away her collection of eroge and anime goods! Kyousuke contacts Ayase who confirms Kirino hasn`t been in contact with her since she left either. Kyousuke then meets up with Ruri who encourages him to fly to America to find the root of Kirino`s problem - and before the boy leaves she puts a special jinx on him.

episode.title: 俺の後輩がこんなに可愛いわけがない
There`s No Way My Kouhai Can Be This Cute
Ma disciple ne peut pas être aussi mignonne
Ore no Kouhai ga Konna ni Kawaii Wake ga Nai
episode.summary: With Sena and Kuroneko constantly quarreling in the Games Development club, the club president decides they`ll have to write a game together and submit it to an online contest. Both girls have different concepts about the game`s theme, so they`ll both present them to the club whose members will then decide by majority vote whose concept will have to be implemented. And Kyousuke, with no programming skills thus acting as supervisor for the team, suggests to write an eroge - in order to have less competition and a better chance to win the contest.

episode.title: 俺の後輩がこんなに腐ってるわけがない
There`s No Way My Kouhai Can Be This Rotten
Ma disciple ne peut pas être aussi pourrie
Ore no Kouhai ga Konna ni Kusatteru Wake ga Nai
episode.summary: Kuroneko (real name: Gokou Ruri) enrolls in Kyousuke`s school, and Saori feels downhearted that she hasn`t heard from Kirino. Kyousuke notices that Ruri is having trouble making friends due to her personality, so he decides they should try a membership at their school`s Games Research club where the boy meets two other persons he never expected to be there as well.

episode.title: 俺の妹の人生相談がこれで終わるわけがない TRUE ROUTE
There`s No Way My Little Sister`s Life Advice Can End Like This (True Route)
Les conseils pour ma petite soeur ne peuvent se finir ainsi (True Route)
Ore no Imouto no Jinsei Soudan ga Kore de Owaru Wake ga Nai: True Route
